alert.note: Alert for Pike (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 2:42PM EDT until July 15 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Localized minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New York and northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, in central New York, Sullivan. In northeast Pennsylvania, Pike. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 240 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to isolated, redeveloping thunderstorms over the same area. Minor flooding may be ongoing or is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - These locations have been hit with repeat rounds of heavy rainfall in the last few days and are sensitive to more heavy rain. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lackawaxen, Eldred, Highland Lake, Tusten, Beaver Brook, Barryville, Westcolang Park, Rowland, Forestburgh and Mongaup Valley Wildlife Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
